0.name: Cognitive Biases
0.description: List of biases and counter-strategies to improve reasoning.

1.name: Confirmation Bias
1.description: The tendency to search for, interpret, and remember information that confirms one's preconceptions.

2.name: Seek Disconfirming Evidence
2.description: Actively look for information that contradicts your beliefs to challenge your assumptions.

3.name: Anchoring Bias
3.description: The reliance on the first piece of information encountered when making decisions.

4.name: Consider Multiple Perspectives
4.description: Evaluate different viewpoints to reduce the impact of initial anchors.

5.name: Hindsight Bias
5.description: The inclination to see events as having been predictable after they have already occurred.

6.name: Document Predictions
6.description: Record predictions before events occur to evaluate accuracy later.

7.name: Overconfidence Bias
7.description: The tendency to overestimate one's abilities or the accuracy of one's knowledge.

8.name: Seek Feedback
8.description: Regularly ask for feedback from others to gain an objective view of your capabilities.

9.name: Availability Heuristic
9.description: Relying on immediate examples that come to mind when evaluating a specific topic.

10.name: Research Data
10.description: Gather comprehensive data and statistics to make informed decisions instead of relying on memory.

11.name: Bandwagon Effect
11.description: The tendency to adopt beliefs or behaviors because others are doing so.

12.name: Independent Evaluation
12.description: Make decisions based on personal values and research rather than peer influence.

13.name: Self-Serving Bias
13.description: The habit of attributing positive events to one's own character, but attributing negative events to external factors.

14.name: Reflect on Failures
14.description: Acknowledge and analyze personal mistakes to promote accountability.

15.name: Sunk Cost Fallacy
15.description: The tendency to continue an endeavor once an investment in money, effort, or time has been made.

16.name: Assess Future Value
16.description: Evaluate decisions based on future benefits rather than past investments.

17.name: Framing Effect
17.description: The way information is presented can influence decisions and judgments.

18.name: Reframe the Information
18.description: Look at the information from different angles to avoid biased interpretations.

19.name: Dunning-Kruger Effect
19.description: The cognitive bias in which people with low ability at a task overestimate their ability.

20.name: Continuous Learning
20.description: Commit to lifelong learning and skill development to gain a realistic view of your abilities.
